title: How to prove by mathematical induction 2^3+4^3+6^3+…+(2n)^3 = 2n^2(n+1)^2 - Quora

response.answer_text: [math]2^3 + 4^3 + 6^3 +\cdots + (2 n)^3 = 2 n^2 (n + 1)^2[/math] [math]\text{The result is true for n = 1, since}[/math] [math]2^3 = 2(1)^2 (1 + 1)^2 = 8[/math] [math]\text{Let the result be true for n = k, that is}[/math] [math]2^3 + 4^3 + 6^3 +\cdots + (2 k)^3 = 2 k^2 (k + 1)^2[/math] [math]\text{we need to prove that the result is also true for n = k + 1, that is}[/math] [math]2^3 + 4^3 + 6^3 +\cdots + (2 k)^3  + (2 k + 2)^3= 2 (k + 1)^2 (k + 2)^2[/math] [math]\text{by our assumption}[/math] [math]2^3 + 4^3 + 6^3 +\cdots + (2 k)^3 = 2 k^2 (k + 1)^2[/math] [math]\text{adding}\,\, (2 k + 2)^3\,\,\text{on both sides}[/math] [math]2^3 + 4^3 + 6^3 +\cdots + (2 k)^3 + (2 k + 2)^3 = 2 k^2 (k + 1)^2 + (2 k + 2)^3[/math] [math]=2 k^2 (k + 1)^2 + 2^3(k + 1)^3 = 2 (k + 1)^2\{k^2 + 4 (k + 1)\} = 2 (k + 1)^2 (k + 2)^2[/math] [math]\therefore\,\,\text{The result is also true for n = k + 1. Hence by the principle of}[/math] [math]\text{mathematical induction, the result is true for all n}\in\Z^{+}.[/math]
